  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Manager",
  "description": "Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group &ndash; the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Manager

Requisition ID: 15936
Job Location:&nbsp;Mfamosing, Cross River

About the Job


	To ensure the products produced are fit for purpose and meet both external and internal requirements, including legal compliance and customer expectations.
	Coordinates the activities required to meet&nbsp;quality standards and provide input to ensure that products are competitive in the market.&nbsp;
	Quality manager also monitors and advise on the performance of the quality management system and&nbsp;produces data and report on performance, measuring against set indicators.&nbsp;


What you&#39;ll be doing


	OH&amp;S and environment: Guarantee and foster compliance with OH&amp;S and environment policies for&nbsp;all quality personnel. Ensure cleanliness within quality premises and contribute to plant cleanliness
	Quality lab operations: Plan, organize and manage sampling, measurements and analysis&nbsp;throughout the production process. Ensure calibration and maintenance of equipment is properly&nbsp;done.
	Quality operations: Carefully analyze quality performance, timely identify any deviation from&nbsp;standards and investigate causes. Collaborate with the Quarry Manager, Production Manager and&nbsp;Process Manager to define corrective and preventive actions.
	Standards: Ensure that the appropriate quality system is in place and manage it in line with necessary&nbsp;regulations. Prepare and coordinate across departments ISO and NIS certification; ensure correct&nbsp;implementation of the corrective actions identified through audits.
	People management: Inform and motivate quality personnel, ensure their availability and&nbsp;performance according to plant needs and promote their professional development through coaching,&nbsp;individual development plans and trainings.
	Management &ndash; Planning and cost control: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to&nbsp;define product and process requirements. Investigate and propose possible ways to maximize the&nbsp;tradeoff between benefits and costs of the quality system.
	Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Together with the Process Manager and Production&nbsp;Manager, consider and propose new techniques and/or technologies to optimize costs and improve&nbsp;quality. Investigate and validate impact of product, production and process changes onto quality


Who you&#39;ll be working with:


	External&nbsp;
	
		Industrial Director&nbsp;
		Head of Quality and Materials
	
	
	Direct Reports
	
		Optimization Manager
		Plant Manager
	
	


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	A University graduate from any one of the following disciplines:&nbsp;Chemistry,&nbsp;Chemical Engineering and Materials Science&nbsp;
	At least 3 years of experience in a similar role in any cement manufacturing company; experience&nbsp;in ISO certifications.
	At least 5 years of experience as an assistant manager in laboratories of industrial companies;&nbsp;experience in ISO certifications.
	At least 7 years of experience in laboratories of industrial companies; experience in ISO&nbsp;certifications
	Statistical knowledge. Knowledge in cement and possibly experience in cement application
	Assurance
	Cement manufacturing and application (clinker manufacturing, Cement &amp; Clinker&nbsp;Chemistry, Cement additives, Cement application in Concrete, Process parameters, etc)
	Data Management and reporting (Microsoft Office, SAP, TIS/LIMS)
	QC Equipment and methods (CBA/PGNAA, XRF, XRD, Concrete testing, Clinker&nbsp;Microscopy, application-orientated tests)
	Works cooperatively with others across the organization to meet the customer&rsquo;s needs
	Follows through on commitments while pushing self and others to achieve results with&nbsp;zero harm to people
	Holds self and others accountable; instills trust by showing consistency between words&nbsp;and actions
	Demonstrates commitment in environmental stewardship
	Develops self and coaches others to reach full potential by inspiring and empowering them

Quality Manager Job at Lafarge Africa Plc




        
    

        
        Lafarge Africa Plc is a member of the LafargeHolcim Group – the biggest building and concrete solutions company in the world. It is a publicly quoted company on the Nigerian Stock Exchange (NSE) and serves Nigeria with a wide range of building and construction solutions designed to meet housing and construction needs from small projects like individual home buildings to major construction and infrastructure projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Manager

Requisition ID: 15936
Job Location: Mfamosing, Cross River

About the Job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To ensure the products produced are fit for purpose and meet both external and internal requirements, including legal compliance and customer expectations.
	Coordinates the activities required to meet quality standards and provide input to ensure that products are competitive in the market. 
	Quality manager also monitors and advise on the performance of the quality management system and produces data and report on performance, measuring against set indicators. 


What you'll be doing


	OH&S and environment: Guarantee and foster compliance with OH&S and environment policies for all quality personnel. Ensure cleanliness within quality premises and contribute to plant cleanliness
	Quality lab operations: Plan, organize and manage sampling, measurements and analysis throughout the production process. Ensure calibration and maintenance of equipment is properly done.
	Quality operations: Carefully analyze quality performance, timely identify any deviation from standards and investigate causes. Collaborate with the Quarry Manager, Production Manager and Process Manager to define corrective and preventive actions.
	Standards: Ensure that the appropriate quality system is in place and manage it in line with necessary regulations. Prepare and coordinate across departments ISO and NIS certification; ensure correct implementation of the corrective actions identified through audits.
	People management: Inform and motivate quality personnel, ensure their availability and performance according to plant needs and promote their professional development through coaching, individual development plans and trainings.
	Management – Planning and cost control: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to define product and process requirements. Investigate and propose possible ways to maximize the tradeoff between benefits and costs of the quality system.
	Innovation and Continuous Improvement: Together with the Process Manager and Production Manager, consider and propose new techniques and/or technologies to optimize costs and improve quality. Investigate and validate impact of product, production and process changes onto quality


Who you'll be working with:


	External 
	
		Industrial Director 
		Head of Quality and Materials
	
	
	Direct Reports
	
		Optimization Manager
		Plant Manager
	
	


Requirements
What we are looking for:


	A University graduate from any one of the following disciplines: Chemistry, Chemical Engineering and Materials Science 
	At least 3 years of experience in a similar role in any cement manufacturing company; experience in ISO certifications.
	At least 5 years of experience as an assistant manager in laboratories of industrial companies; experience in ISO certifications.
	At least 7 years of experience in laboratories of industrial companies; experience in ISO certifications
	Statistical knowledge. Knowledge in cement and possibly experience in cement application
	Assurance
	Cement manufacturing and application (clinker manufacturing, Cement & Clinker Chemistry, Cement additives, Cement application in Concrete, Process parameters, etc)
	Data Management and reporting (Microsoft Office, SAP, TIS/LIMS)
	QC Equipment and methods (CBA/PGNAA, XRF, XRD, Concrete testing, Clinker Microscopy, application-orientated tests)
	Works cooperatively with others across the organization to meet the customer’s needs
	Follows through on commitments while pushing self and others to achieve results with zero harm to people
	Holds self and others accountable; instills trust by showing consistency between words and actions
	Demonstrates commitment in environmental stewardship
	Develops self and coaches others to reach full potential by inspiring and empowering them

Quality Assurance Manager Job at First Bank of Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria's largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Manager (Lagos & West)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Identification: 1596
Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The Quality Checks & Assurance Manager will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and compliance of architectural and construction-related activities across the organization’s real estate portfolio.
	This role focuses strictly on quality assurance and control, ensuring that all building projects — renovations, face-lifting, and new developments — are executed in accordance with approved designs, regulatory standards, safety protocols, and the organization’s quality expectations.


Requirements
Education:


	B.Sc Degree in Architecture; M.Sc Degree in Architecture; Advanced Cert., Project Management
	Professional Certifications: MNIA, ARCO.


Experience:


	Minimum experience: 10 years of relevant experience needed.

We are&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: SME Business Consultant&nbsp;&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Job Type: Full-Time&nbsp; &amp; Hybrid

Role Overview


	As a SME Business consultant with Shecluded, you will play a key role in strengthening the businesses of women entrepreneurs by providing high-quality advisory, coaching, and capacity-building support.
	You will contribute to program design, business diagnostics, training delivery, and growth strategy development, helping MSMEs become more resilient, profitable, and investment-ready.
	You will work within our programs and community to offer practical, actionable strategies that help women grow and professionalize their businesses.
	You will also support Shecluded with documentation for funding, reporting, and stakeholder engagement, ensuring that our work creates value for both the organization and the clients we serve.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide hands-on business advisory support to women-led MSMEs, delivering practical and actionable strategies to strengthen operations, increase sales, improve financial management, and drive sustainable business growth.
	Develop high-quality documents including proposals, RFP submissions, funding applications, business plans, strategic reports, and other materials that advance Shecluded&rsquo;s programs and partnerships.
	Collaborate closely with internal teams (Programs, Credit, Community, Partnerships) to enhance service delivery, improve client experience, and increase overall value for both clients and Shecluded.
	Support research, data gathering, and market analysis, synthesizing insights into clear recommendations that inform program design, business advisory interventions, and strategic decision-making.
	Monitor client performance and advisory outcomes, tracking progress, identifying gaps, and adjusting support strategies to ensure businesses achieve measurable results.
	Contribute to Shecluded&rsquo;s growth and impact goals by identifying partnership opportunities, supporting stakeholder engagement, and strengthening relationships within the MSME ecosystem.
	Design and facilitate business training, workshops, and coaching sessions, ensuring content is practical, relevant, and aligned with the needs of women entrepreneurs across sectors.
	Ensure high-quality documentation and reporting, maintaining accurate records, preparing advisory summaries, and supporting program monitoring and evaluation efforts.


Qualifications / Requiremnts&nbsp;


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Development Studies, Project Management, or a related field (Master&rsquo;s degree is an added advantage).
	A strong understanding of MSMEs/SMEs and the business climate in Nigeria.
	Strong analytical, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
	Excellent organizational and analytical skills with attention to detail.&nbsp;

	Knowledge of key business drivers, regulatory factors, and operational processes across different sectors.

	Strong Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Excel, Project) and familiarity with Canva or similar business tools.

	Demonstrated leadership or management potential&mdash;ability to coach, coordinate, and guide others.

	Financial literacy &amp; business modeling
	MSME diagnostics
	Proposal writing &amp; reporting
	Training &amp; facilitation
	Problem-solving &amp; critical thinking
	Stakeholder management
	Project coordination

We design and deliver tailored training programs in partnership with organizations and DFIs to educate and empower women within their communities, focusing on business development, financial literacy, and entrepreneurial resilience. We also host community networking events and workshops to strengthen connections and drive visibility for women-led businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: SME Business Consultant

Role Overview


	As a SME Business consultant with Shecluded, you will play a key role in strengthening the businesses of women entrepreneurs by providing high-quality advisory, coaching, and capacity-building support.
	You will contribute to program design, business diagnostics, training delivery, and growth strategy development, helping MSMEs become more resilient, profitable, and investment-ready.
	You will work within our programs and community to offer practical, actionable strategies that help women grow and professionalize their businesses.
	You will also support Shecluded with documentation for funding, reporting, and stakeholder engagement, ensuring that our work creates value for both the organization and the clients we serve.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide hands-on business advisory support to women-led MSMEs, delivering practical and actionable strategies to strengthen operations, increase sales, improve financial management, and drive sustainable business growth.
	Develop high-quality documents including proposals, RFP submissions, funding applications, business plans, strategic reports, and other materials that advance Shecluded’s programs and partnerships.
	Collaborate closely with internal teams (Programs, Credit, Community, Partnerships) to enhance service delivery, improve client experience, and increase overall value for both clients and Shecluded.
	Support research, data gathering, and market analysis, synthesizing insights into clear recommendations that inform program design, business advisory interventions, and strategic decision-making.
	Monitor client performance and advisory outcomes, tracking progress, identifying gaps, and adjusting support strategies to ensure businesses achieve measurable results.

  "description": "Shecluded -&nbsp;We disburse flexible loans to fuel business growth across sectors and deliver structured business and financial literacy training through incubators, accelerators, and cohort-based programs &mdash; both online and in person.

We design and deliver tailored training programs in partnership with organizations and DFIs to educate and empower women within their communities, focusing on business development, financial literacy, and entrepreneurial resilience. We also host community networking events and workshops to strengthen connections and drive visibility for women-led businesses.

We are&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Risk Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time&nbsp; &amp; Hybrid
Reports To:&nbsp;CEO

Role Overview


	We&rsquo;re looking for a Credit Risk Analyst who is passionate about building strong, data-driven credit systems that unlock opportunities for women in business.
	As we continue to tackle the gender finance gap and deepen our impact, we need someone who can bring analytical excellence, sound judgment, and a commitment to maintaining a healthy, high-performing loan portfolio.
	If this is you! We want you!
	The ideal candidate is a problem-solver at heart; someone who enjoys digging into numbers, spotting patterns, and challenging assumptions to make smarter, faster credit decisions.
	They have a strong understanding of credit risk, lending processes, and portfolio dynamics, and are excited about how technology and AI can transform credit for women entrepreneurs.


Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough credit assessments and analyze borrowers&rsquo; financial statements, cash flow, and repayment capacity.
	Review loan applications, prepare credit memos, and make clear recommendations on approval or decline.
	Monitor loan portfolio performance, identify early warning signs, and support strategies to reduce default risk.
	Ensure compliance with credit policies, documentation standards, and risk management procedures.
	Prepare regular credit and portfolio reports to support decision-making by the credit and leadership teams.


What Makes You a Great Fit


	You love problem-solving and naturally think in terms of systems, probabilities, and causes.
	You have a solid grasp of credit analysis, risk assessment, and financial statement interpretation.
	You understand concepts like PD, LGD, ECL, credit scoring, loan performance drivers, and portfolio segmentation (or you&rsquo;re excited to learn).
	You can balance quantitative analysis with sound judgment.
	You know how to translate data into clear decisions and actionable recommendations


Technical Skills We Value:


	Experience with credit risk modelling or exposure to risk frameworks
	Strong Excel/Google Sheets &amp; financial modelling
	Understanding of data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Power BI, or willingness to learn)
	Ability to identify risk patterns, emerging trends, and early warning signals
	Familiarity with digital lending, scoring systems, or credit underwriting best practices
	Ability to contribute to improving credit policies, scoring rules, and internal processes.

Credit Risk Analyst Job at Shecluded




        
    

        
        Shecluded - We disburse flexible loans to fuel business growth across sectors and deliver structured business and financial literacy training through incubators, accelerators, and cohort-based programs — both online and in person.

We design and deliver tailored training programs in partnership with organizations and DFIs to educate and empower women within their communities, focusing on business development, financial literacy, and entrepreneurial resilience. We also host community networking events and workshops to strengthen connections and drive visibility for women-led businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Risk Analyst
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time  & Hybrid
Reports To: CEO

Role Overview


	We’re looking for a Credit Risk Analyst who is passionate about building strong, data-driven credit systems that unlock opportunities for women in business.
	As we continue to tackle the gender finance gap and deepen our impact, we need someone who can bring analytical excellence, sound judgment, and a commitment to maintaining a healthy, high-performing loan portfolio.
	If this is you! We want you!
	The ideal candidate is a problem-solver at heart; someone who enjoys digging into numbers, spotting patterns, and challenging assumptions to make smarter, faster credit decisions.
	They have a strong understanding of credit risk, lending processes, and portfolio dynamics, and are excited about how technology and AI can transform credit for women entrepreneurs.


Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough credit assessments and analyze borrowers’ financial statements, cash flow, and repayment capacity.
	Review loan applications, prepare credit memos, and make clear recommendations on approval or decline.
	Monitor loan portfolio performance, identify early warning signs, and support strategies to reduce default risk.
	Ensure compliance with credit policies, documentation standards, and risk management procedures.
	Prepare regular credit and portfolio reports to support decision-making by the credit and leadership teams.


What Makes You a Great Fit


	You love problem-solving and naturally think in terms of systems, probabilities, and causes.
	You have a solid grasp of credit analysis, risk assessment, and financial statement interpretation.
	You understand concepts like PD, LGD, ECL, credit scoring, loan performance drivers, and portfolio segmentation (or you’re excited to learn).
	You can balance quantitative analysis with sound judgment.
	You know how to translate data into clear decisions and actionable recommendations


Technical Skills We Value:


	Experience with credit risk modelling or exposure to risk frameworks
	Strong Excel/Google Sheets & financial modelling
	Understanding of data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Power BI, or willingness to learn)
	Ability to identify risk patterns, emerging trends, and early warning signals
	Familiarity with digital lending, scoring systems, or credit underwriting best practices
	Ability to contribute to improving credit policies, scoring rules, and internal processes.
